docs.snippet: A former business associate of President Donald Trump who worked as an informant for U.S. government agencies met with representatives of the U.S. Senate Intelligence Committee on Wednesday, according to three people familiar with the meeting.

headline.print_headline: Senate Intelligence Panel Interviews Ex-Trump Business Associate: Sources
headline.main: Senate Intelligence Panel Interviews Ex-Trump Business Associate: Sources

docs.snippet: Before last month's special congressional election in Pennsylvania, U.S. President Donald Trump, who ridiculed his rivals in the 2016 election as “Liddle Marco,” “Lyin’ Ted,” and “Crooked Hillary,” tried i...

headline.print_headline: Democrats Brace for More Trump Name-Calling as U.S. Election Looms
headline.main: Democrats Brace for More Trump Name-Calling as U.S. Election Looms

docs.snippet: Steve Bannon, President Donald Trump's former chief strategist and 2016 campaign CEO, had a fiery response on Wednesday to Wall Street's dim view of Trump's trade actions against China.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Trump Aide Bannon: 'To Hell With Wall Street' View on Trade Moves
headline.main: Ex-Trump Aide Bannon: 'To Hell With Wall Street' View on Trade Moves

docs.snippet: An aide to Russian President Vladimir Putin said Monday that U.S. President Donald Trump invited the Russian leader to the White House when they spoke by telephone last month, but the two countries haven't started any preparations for such a visit...

headline.print_headline: Kremlin: Trump Invited Putin to White House, but No Date Set
headline.main: Kremlin: Trump Invited Putin to White House, but No Date Set

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump will sign a proclamation on Wednesday ordering the deployment of the National Guard to help protect the border with Mexico, Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen said.

headline.print_headline: Trump to Order National Guard to Protect Border With Mexico: Official
headline.main: Trump to Order National Guard to Protect Border With Mexico: Official

docs.snippet: The Trump administration is postponing until September a summit with Gulf Arab leaders that had been planned for this spring amid an ongoing dispute between Qatar and other U.S. allies in the region, according to five U.S. officials.

headline.print_headline: White House Postpones Planned Trump Summit With Gulf Leaders-Sources
headline.main: White House Postpones Planned Trump Summit With Gulf Leaders-Sources

docs.snippet: U.S. Special Counsel Robert Mueller told President Donald Trump's attorneys last month he was continuing to investigate the president but did not consider him a criminal target in the Russia probe "at this point," the Washington Post reported on T...

headline.print_headline: Mueller Said Last Month Trump Not a Criminal Target 'at This Point': Washington Post
headline.main: Mueller Said Last Month Trump Not a Criminal Target 'at This Point': Washington Post

docs.snippet: Japanese government officials are bracing for Donald Trump to get tough in trade talks, and are particularly anxious that the U.S. president could target Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's weak-yen policies.

headline.print_headline: Japan Braces for Trump Assault on Trade, Yen Policy as Summit Looms
headline.main: Japan Braces for Trump Assault on Trade, Yen Policy as Summit Looms

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump is pointing to a 50 percent job approval rating that may not fully comport with reality.

headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Cites Questionable Job Approval Rating
headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Cites Questionable Job Approval Rating

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's personal lawyer asked a federal judge on Monday to force adult film star Stormy Daniels to use arbitration to settle a dispute over an agreement to keep quiet about a sexual encounter she says she had with Trump.

headline.print_headline: Trump Attorney Seeks to Force Porn Star's Lawsuit Into Arbitration
headline.main: Trump Attorney Seeks to Force Porn Star's Lawsuit Into Arbitration
